--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Mike Forsberg <bigmike@...> wrote:
>
> I need=
ed the same thing and looked at the junit ext project=85 but found their
> =
implementation a little "weird".
> 
> So in my free time, I implemented a c=
onfigurable test filter based on system
> properties.  It can be found at h=
ttp://github.com/bigmikef/junit-addons/.

Thanks, the only problem is that =
your solution require me to use a specific runner. Once I do that I am unab=
le to configure other runners like "@RunWith(Parameterized.class)" which I =
also need to use.

This is really a problem with the design of JUnit4. and =
not your filter (Spring has the same problem due to the Junit4 RunWith limi=
tations). IMO this aspect of JUnit should be completely redesigned.
